Comments_List:
software engineering basics. 
coding styles.
group work.
working in a team to develop software
I gained extensive experience working in teams to develop a software engineering from start to shipping in a start-up like environment / setup.

The course gives a straightforward idea of what it feels like to work in a team and cooperate to finish something you can be proud of. There is so much to learn from the ones you work with.
However, there are too many document-style tasks. Although I know it's inevitable in real life software engineering practice, I still feel it's too much.
project was useful, class lectures could have been more informative

The course is well-structured, with timely feedback and reviews to help the team stay on track. 

One way to improve is probably release the peer-review feedbacks to students after course ends so that we can reflect back and improve our team working skills.

If you want to accomplish a project, you should choose this course, because it's pretty pushy.
If, however, you want to know basic ideas of SE, then you should probably avoid this, because this course emphasizes coding more than concepts.
Yes it was a good class but mostly for the project aspect. However I found the content to be a bit unorganized/dry and don't feel like I learned that much in the lectures
Yes, can learn Software development cycle, which is important.

Definitely would. This course provides a really nice opportunity for anyone who wants to gain some real software development experience using agile. It is super fun to be able to cook your cool idea to completion. (It gives a lot of sense of achievement as well! )
Yes please please take the class
